title: 'It would be incredible': A lot at stake for the four golfers on top of the U.S. Open leaderboard
content: The four leaders heading into the final round might be a surprise. But all four have set themselves up to be a part of history on Sunday.

title: Sources: Grizz send Bane to Magic in blockbuster
content: The Grizzlies are trading Desmond Bane to the Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four unprotected first-round picks and one first-round pick swap, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Marchand makes history in Panthers' Game 5 win
content: Brad Marchand became the first player to score at least five goals in two separate Stanley Cup Final series with two different teams as the Panthers reached the brink of a second straight Stanley Cup with a 5-2 win over the Oilers.

title: Durant prefers Heat, Spurs, Rockets, sources say
content: The Heat, Spurs and Rockets are Suns star Kevin Durant's preferred trade destinations, sources told ESPN.

title: Maria wins Queen's Club title in women's return
content: German qualifier Tatjana Maria capped an incredible week in London as she defeated American No. 8 seed Amanda Anisimova 6-3, 6-4 to become the first woman to win a title at Queen's Club in over half a century.

title: Ohtani back in form, homers twice to end drought
content: Shohei Ohtani hit his 24th and 25th homers of the season to halt a 10-game drought Saturday night against the Giants.

title: Still got it: Usman tops Buckley in 1st win since '21
content: Kamaru Usman got back on the winning track, outwrestling Joaquin Buckley to score a unanimous decision victory in the main event of UFC Fight Night in Atlanta.

title: Rockies have worst 70-game mark since 1899
content: After a loss to Atlanta left Colorado with a 13-57 record, the Rockies have the fourth-fewest wins by any team through their first 70 decisions in a season in MLB history and the fewest since the 1899 Spiders.

title: Poch: Pulisic can't dictate which games he plays
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said he wouldn't allow Christian Pulisic to dictate which games he would be available for.

title: Title leader Oscar Piastri still hopeful after P3 qualifying
content: Formula 1 leader Oscar Piastri stayed hopeful after a qualifying session that had McLaren boss Andrea Stella talking of damage limitation in Sunday's Canadian Grand Prix.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

content: With Father's Day here, the OU signee and her dad reflect on a relationship forged through tough practices together -- a bond that might not have otherwise existed.

content: Tennessee's No. 1 pick credits his dad for emailing coaches and driving him all over Texas just to get him a chance.

title: PSG inspired by SoFi as new stadium hunt begins

title: Messi denied late as Miami draws CWC opener

content: Italy are set to appoint their former midfielder Gennaro Gattuso as new head coach to replace the recently sacked Luciano Spalletti, Gianluigi Buffon said.

title: Mexico holds off D.R. to begin Gold Cup with win
content: Defending champion Mexico overcame a slow start to defeat the Dominican Republic 3-2 on Saturday night in a Concacaf Gold Cup group stage match.

title: Inter's Taremi stuck in Iran and will miss CWC
content: Inter Milan forward Mehdi Taremi will not be able to join his teammates at the Club World Cup in the United States as he is stuck in Tehran amid the escalating conflict between Iran and Israel.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out
content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

content: The Chairman of the Film Development Corporation and film producer was not happy on top stars skipping the film awards

title: AISF demands criminal action against FIITJEE for downing shutters without notice

title: India must stand with international law and UN charter: Ukraine Minister

content: Odisha is the only State to host the wild populations of all three native species ‚Äî gharial, saltwater crocodile¬†and mugger

title: Three West Bengal residents pushed into Bangladesh by BSF, return after State govt.‚Äôs intervention

content: The State‚Äôs installed wind power capacity is now more than the combined capacity of countries like South Africa, Portugal, and New Zealand

title: 98.52% secure Plus One allotment in main phase
content: A total of 3.12 lakh students have got allotment till now; 87,928 students got fresh allotment in third list alone

content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah reviews preparations for the two-phase exercise which will conclude by March 1, 2027

content: The Act is aimed at protecting the weaker and vulnerable groups and individuals from the coercive methods of recovering loans by money-lending entities such as micro-finance institutions¬†and money-lending agencies operating in the State

title: Pune Bridge Collapse Live Updates:  Rs 5 Lakh Aid For Families Of Those Killed In Bridge Collapse Near Pune
content: Four people were killed after a bridge on a river near Pune collapsed on Sunday afternoon. Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has announced financial aid for families of those killed in the bridge collapse.

title: Non-Servitors Banned From Climbing Chariots During Rath Yatra: Odisha Minister
content: The Odisha government will take stringent legal action, including arrests, against any non-servitor found climbing the chariots during this year's Rath Yatra in Puri, Law Minister Prithviraj Harichandan said on Sunday.

title: "If There Is Any Anger...": PMK Leader Anbumani Seeks Forgiveness From Father S Ramadoss
content: PMK top leader Anbumani on Sunday appealed to his father, party founder S Ramadoss to forgive him in case of "anger" against him and asserted that he is ready to follow his diktats and realise his dreams for the party

title: Crypto, Golf, Watches, Perfumes: How Trump Earned Over $600 Million in 2024
content: Donald Trump pocketed more than $57 million from token sales by the crypto venture he and his sons helped launch last year, according to federal financial disclosure forms.

title: 4 Killed In Maharashtra Bridge Collapse, PM Modi Speaks To Chief Minister
content: Four tourists have died and several others are feared to have drowned after a bridge built over the Indrayani river in Pune collapsed.

title: From Dadar To Reshimbagh, Political Groundwork Begins For Maharashtra Civic Polls
content: As civic polls draw near in Maharashtra, political parties have shifted into full gear, holding internal meetings, strategy camps, and grassroots outreach programmes - some across the state, others concentrated in their traditional strongholds.

title: Trump Administration Weighs Adding 36 Countries To Travel Ban, Memo Says
content: US President Donald Trump's administration is considering significantly expanding its travel ban by potentially banning citizens of 36 additional countries from entering the United States, according to an internal State Department cable.

content: Four tourists have died and 39 have been rescued after an iron bridge over the Indrayani river near Pune collapsed.

title: Lalu Prasad Gets Minorities' Panel Notice For Allegedly Disrespecting BR Ambedkar
content: The Bihar State Commission for Scheduled Castes has issued a notice to RJD president Lalu Prasad for allegedly disrespecting Babasaheb Bhim Rao Ambedkar.

title: Russian Air Attack Damaged Boeing Offices In Ukraine: Report
content: A building used by Boeing in Kyiv was badly damaged in a recent large-scale Russian air attack, the Financial Times reported, citing six people familiar with the matter.

title: Helpdesk Launched For Claim Assistance to Families of Ahmedabad Plane Crash Victims
content: In the aftermath of the tragic plane crash in Ahmedabad, the district administration has taken significant steps to ensure that the legal heirs of those killed receive timely insurance and claim-related support.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Updates: 47 Victims Identified Through DNA Testing, Vijay Rupani's Funeral Tomorrow
content: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Updates: 47 people who died in the Air India Ahmedabad-London plane crash were identified through DNA testing, while authorities handed over bodies of 25 victims to their families.

title: Daylight Murder In Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri, Theatre Artiste Hacked To Death
content: A theatre artiste has been brutally hacked to death in public view in Krishnagiri district of Tamil Nadu. The man, identified as Venkatesan, was attacked with a sickle by a man identified as Chinna Narasimhan.

title: "Was Of Paper": BJP After Minister Faces FIR For Throwing Slipper At Man
content: An FIR has been lodged against Union minister Sukanta Majumdar at a police station in Kolkata alleging he threw a slipper at a Sikh man which hit his turban, the ruling Trinamool Congress claimed on Sunday.

title: India Issues Fresh Advisory For Nationals In Israel Amid Iranian Strikes
content: India on Sunday issued a fresh advisory for nationals in Israel as tensions in the Middle East continued to rise.

title: Tension In Manipur Village After Meitei Farmer Alleges Kukis Stopped Him From Ploughing Paddy Field
content: A farmer from the Meitei community who went to plough a paddy field was stopped by some members of the Kuki tribes, leading to tension in a foothill village in the interdistrict border between Manipur's Imphal East and Kangpokpi.

title: India Issues Fresh Advisory For Nationals In Israel Amid Iranian Strikes
content: India on Sunday issued a fresh advisory for nationals in Israel as tensions in the Middle East continued to rise.

title: India Issues Fresh Advisory For Nationals In Israel Amid Iranian Strikes
content: India on Sunday issued a fresh advisory for nationals in Israel as tensions in the Middle East continued to rise.

title: Nearly 7,000 UK University Students Caught Cheating Using AI: Report
content: Nearly 7,000 university students in the UK were caught cheating using ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence tools during the 2023-24 academic year, according to data obtained by The Guardian.

title: River Bridge Near Pune Was Rusted, Probably Collapsed Due To Crowding: Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Sunday said the iron bridge over the Indrayani river was rusted and prima facie it gave way as several people were standing on the structure, killing two individuals.

content: Kasaragod, Kannur, Kozhikode, Wayanad, and Malappuram on red alert on Monday. Mining operations banned in Kottayam till June 17

content: The students have made us proud by achieving outstanding ranks through their talent and hard work, he says in a post on X

content: Through the project, the district administration aims to provide financial assistance to students who are in need

content: APSRTC Staff and Workers Federation leaders express concern over the government‚Äôs ‚Äúanti-worker policies‚Äù and say that they will participate in a State-wide protest on June 19

content: Kerala Bird Monitoring Collective, which is organisinf the event along with Kerala Agricultural University, is celebrating a decade of impactful citizen science in bird observation and conservation

content: A Division Bench of the High Court, on June 13, upheld a single judge order dated April 2, which had directed all bike taxi services to wind up operations within six weeks

content: The Commission asked the RJD leader to provide an explanation within 15 days or else a case would be registered against him under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act

content: Senate members urged VC to allow students to choose minor courses aligned with major subjects to avoid forcing them into areas they are not interested in

content: In contrast, coverage has been above expectations in 11 districts; across the State, the coverage is 90.64 %

content: Mission marks India‚Äôs return to human spaceflight; the launch, first set for May 29, has been pushed four times, due to an oxygen leak in the Falcon-9 rocket and an ISS module snag; ‚Äúimponderables‚Äù remain, says Minister

title: KSEB plea for resumption of long-term power supply contracts rejected
content: State Electricity Regulatory Commission rejects plea saying that its 2023 order permitting the contracts had been set aside by Appellate Tribunal for Electricity and Supreme Court

content: The State government has planned a total investment of ‚Çπ4 crore for the restoration of the island to regain its former appeal, according to the Department of Tourism officials

title: NMC issues show-cause notice to 26 Telangana government medical colleges
content: The NMC‚Äôs notice, which flags deficiencies in infrastructure, clinical material, and teaching personnel, comes as part of its routine annual assessment of medical institutions across the country¬†

title: Iran under fire: Israel bombs Mashhad airport; calls it longest-range strike yet - video
content: Israel has confirmed conducting an airstrike on Mashhad airport in Iran, targeting a military refuelling aircraft in what it claims was its longest-range strike. Iranian media reported explosions and fires in Mashhad, activating air defenses. The Israeli Chief of Staff stated the Air Force is attacking Iran‚Äôs infrastructure extensively, aiming to remove an existential threat.

title: Pune bridge collapse: Death toll climbs to 4; PM Modi speaks to CM on rescue ops
content: An iron bridge over the Indrayani river near Pune collapsed on Sunday, resulting in casualties and injuries. Reports confirm four fatalities and 32 injuries, with several individuals swept away by the river. Rescue operations are underway, with the NDRF team deployed to assist. Authorities are on high alert, and injured individuals are receiving medical treatment.

title: India's intrasquad match: Shardul slams 122 not out; all you need to know
content: Shardul Thakur's impressive, unbeaten 122 off 68 balls in the intra-squad match against India A has strengthened his case for inclusion in the first Test against England. Sarfaraz Khan also scored a century. Watched by chief selector Ajit Agarkar and VVS Laxman, Thakur's performance gives him an edge over Nitish Kumar Reddy.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: Facing US restrictions on advanced AI chips, Chinese firms are innovating by processing data abroad. Engineers transported data to Malaysia, utilizing Nvidia chips in local data centers to train AI models. Southeast Asia is becoming a hub for these activities, testing the limits of regulatory oversight as data centers rapidly expand.

title: Gold for India! Hillang Yajik shines; internet goes crazy
content: Hillang Yajik from Arunachal Pradesh made history by winning a gold medal in the Women's Model Physique category at the 15th South Asian Bodybuilding and Physique Sports Championships 2025 in Bhutan. She also secured a silver medal. Yajik is the first woman athlete from Arunachal Pradesh to achieve this feat in an international physique sports tournament.

title: AI Vadodara-bound flight safely returns to IGIA after suspected landing gear snag
content: An Air India flight, AI 819 from Delhi to Vadodara, made a safe return to IGI Airport shortly after takeoff on Sunday evening due to a suspected issue with the landing gear. The Airbus A321, carrying passengers, took off at 6:51 pm, and pilots suspected the landing gear did not retract properly.

title: Board, deboard and repeat: AI Express Guwahati-Kolkata flight delayed by 18 hours
content: Air India Express flight IX-1226 faced a significant delay. The flight from Guwahati to Kolkata was grounded twice. Technical issues caused an 18-hour disruption. Passengers experienced discomfort with hotel stays. An alternate aircraft was arranged for travel. Some passengers opted for other airlines. The replacement flight finally departed on Sunday afternoon. Air India Express offered refunds and rescheduling.

title: World's second richest man: Jeff Bezos loses world‚Äôs No 2 spot; who's taken his place
content: Larry Ellison surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's second-richest person, driven by a $26 billion surge in his net worth following Oracle's strong earnings report. Ellison's total wealth reached $243 billion, exceeding Bezos' $227 billion and Zuckerberg's $239 billion. Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual with $407.3 billion.

title: 'Absolutely incorrect': Rafale maker on Pakistan‚Äôs claim on Op Sindoor
content: Dassault Aviation CEO √âric Trappier refuted Pakistan's claims of shooting down Rafale fighter jets during the conflict with India, labeling them as inaccurate. This statement follows General Chauhan's dismissal of Pakistan's assertions regarding downed Indian warplanes during Operation Sindoor. India has acknowledged and rectified tactical errors, successfully striking targets deep within Pakistani territory.

title: Pune bridge collapse: Dramatic video shows crumbled structure as river rages below
content: A tragic incident occurred in Pune district as an old iron bridge over the Indrayani River collapsed near Kundamala village, resulting in two fatalities and 32 injuries, with six individuals in critical condition. Rescue operations are underway, with NDRF personnel and police teams working to locate those feared trapped. Authorities have rescued six people so far, and search efforts continue on a war footing.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai talks AI race; says leading company is like coaching Barcelona
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai addressed criticism about Google's AI progress after ChatGPT's launch and calls for his resignation. He stated he was aware of Google's internal AI developments, including bringing together Brain and DeepMind teams. Pichai emphasized his ability to ignore distractions and focus on important signals, comparing his role to coaching a major sports team.

title: Drama! Johnson slams Hazlewood for playing in IPL over national duty: 'We've ...'
content: Mitchell Johnson has criticised Josh Hazlewood's choice to play in the IPL instead of preparing for the World Test Championship. Hazlewood's performance in the final was underwhelming. Johnson also raised concerns about the future of Australia's bowling attack. He suggested giving opportunities to younger players in the upcoming West Indies series.

title: 'Just like I got India and Pakistan ...': Trump claims he can end Israel-Iran conflict
content: Amid escalating Israeli airstrikes on Iran, US President Donald Trump claimed he could broker peace, citing his past success in de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Trump said on Truth Social that a deal between Iran and Israel is achievable, similar to his intervention with India and Pakistan. As fighting continues in the Middle East, Trump said he‚Äôs been taking calls and holding meetings behind the scenes.

title: Israel releases strike footage: 50 jets bomb Tehran nuclear sites; over 80 targets hit
content: Amid escalating conflict, Israel targeted critical infrastructure linked to Iran's nuclear program in Tehran, with about 50 fighter jets striking key sites. Iran retaliated, hitting Israeli aircraft refuelling sites and warning of a broader response. Casualties are mounting on both sides, with dozens killed and hundreds wounded.

title: IND vs ENG | Like England have Bashir, India should back Kuldeep: Ex-India cricketer
content: With Ashwin's retirement, Kuldeep Yadav is expected to lead India's spin attack in the upcoming Test series against England. Former spinner Venkatapathy Raju believes Kuldeep could be a surprise weapon, given the favorable weather conditions. Despite Sarfaraz Khan's impressive form, his exclusion from the squad continues, while Raju suggests he waits for his opportunity.

title: Exclusive: Why is chess so cruel? Ask Grandmaster SL Narayanan
content: Grandmaster SL Narayanan, the top-rated player at the Delhi International Open GM Chess Tournament, experienced a disappointing finish after a strong start. Despite aiming for victory, a series of draws against lower-rated opponents led to a seventh-place result. Narayanan reflects on the mental challenges and the importance of maintaining a strong mindset for future success in his chess career.

title: Indian embassies in Iran and Israel ask nationals to stay in contact
content: Amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, the Indian Embassy in Iran has issued advisories for Indian nationals. The embassy shared helpline numbers and a Telegram link to provide updates and ensure the safety of Indians currently in Iran.

title: 'If you‚Äôre not good enough, it‚Äôs better to ...': Kohli on Father's Day
content: Virat Kohli remembered his father, Prem Kohli, on Father's Day. He shared lessons about hard work and integrity. Anushka Sharma posted family photos with Virat and their children, Vamika and Akaay. Vamika's handwritten card for her father was a highlight. Anushka also honoured her own father, Ajay Sharma. This Father's Day follows Virat's retirement from Test cricket.

title: 'It's okay': Yuvraj Singh takes a cheeky dig at Australia as SA win WTC title
content: Yuvraj Singh celebrated South Africa's historic World Test Championship victory over Australia at Lord's, ending their 27-year ICC trophy drought. He lauded Aiden Markram's century and Temba Bavuma's leadership, while playfully teasing the Aussies. South Africa's dominant performance, fueled by Markram's 136 and Bavuma's 66, secured a five-wicket win and their eighth consecutive Test victory.

title: Did Kohli ghost ABD? SA legend admits 'blunder', says 'relieved when he started talking again'
content: South Africa legend AB de Villiers revealed a temporary fallout with Virat Kohli after prematurely disclosing information about Kohli's personal life in early 2024. De Villiers shared that Kohli ceased communication for months following the blunder, which involved publicly announcing Anushka Sharma's pregnancy. He expressed relief when Kohli eventually resumed contact.

title: 'Express my gratitude': PM Modi gets warm welcome in Cyprus - video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Cyprus on Sunday, marking the first visit by an Indian Prime Minister in over two decades. He aims to strengthen ties in trade, investment, and security. Following Cyprus, Modi will attend the G7 Summit in Canada, focusing on global economic stability and climate change, before concluding his tour in Croatia to discuss strategic cooperation.

title: 11 sixes! DC flop Jake Fraser-McGurk lights up cricket in USA - Watch
content: Jake Fraser-McGurk's explosive 88 off 38 balls propelled San Francisco Unicorns to a formidable 219-8. His innings, featuring eleven sixes, ranks second-highest in Major League Cricket. Partnering with Finn Allen (52), Fraser-McGurk's aggressive batting helped Unicorns defeat Los Angeles Knight Riders by 32 runs. The victory moved SF Unicorns to the top of the league table.

title: MLC: Unmukt Chand smashes quickfire fifty for SRK's team - viral video
content: Unmukt Chand showcased his talent in the MLC season, scoring a half-century for the Los Angeles Knight Riders. Despite his impressive 53 off 32 balls, the team fell short of the target. Chand, aiming for a spot in the USA cricket team, eyes the IPL 2025 mega-auction after retiring from Indian cricket in 2021.

title: Credit over caution: Household savings in India fall to 18.1% of GDP
content: Indian household savings declined for the third year to 18.1% of GDP. Household debt nearly doubled in ten years. Gross domestic savings also witnessed a dip. Rural India shows promise with rising wages and easing inflation. Retail inflation hit a low of 3.2% in April 2025. The Indian economy grew by 6.5% in FY25. Corporate India is controlling costs.

title: Bumrah's bowling video from England; seamer breathes fires - Watch
content: Ahead of their Test series against England, the Indian cricket team is utilising a non-televised intra-squad match in Beckenham for preparation. Performance analysts from India and India A are employing specialised camera setups to collect crucial match data. This data helps assess player performance and simulate match conditions, ensuring broadcast-quality analysis despite the absence of live television coverage.

title: Shane Lowry‚Äôs US Open meltdown: 'F-bombs' caught on hot mic amid tough round
content: Shane Lowry's US Open spiraled downwards as his frustration peaked at Oakmont, resulting in multiple F-bombs caught on a hot mic after a missed par putt. His struggles included a one-stroke penalty for picking up his ball without marking it, compounding his woes. Lowry's emotional outbursts and on-course errors highlighted a difficult tournament.

title: Trump's parade: WH denies Munir invite; BJP demands Congress apology for spreading 'fake news'
content: Bharatiya Janata Party criticized Congress for claiming Pakistan's army chief was invited to a US military parade. The White House denied the claim. BJP MP Nishikant Dubey accused Congress of falling into Pakistan‚Äôs trap. Dubey also attacked Congress‚Äôs foreign policy history. Donald Trump hosted a military parade. Protests erupted in major cities.

title: Kohli's daughter writes heartwarming note; Anushka shares pic - post goes viral
content: Anushka Sharma celebrated Father's Day with heartfelt posts. She shared a sweet card from daughter Vamika to Virat Kohli. Vamika's adorable note charmed many fans online. Anushka also posted a photo of her father, Ajay Sharma. The Kohli family recently welcomed their son, Akaay. Virat retired from Test cricket in May 2025. The couple continues to protect their children's privacy.

title: U'khand chopper crash: Aryan Aviation operations suspended; licences of 2 pilots revoked
content: Following a fatal helicopter crash near Guptkashi that claimed seven lives, the civil aviation ministry has suspended Aryan Aviation's Char Dham Yatra operations. The Uttarakhand government has also temporarily halted helicopter services on the route and initiated a high-level investigation. The tragic incident, involving a private chopper returning from Kedarnath, prompted the Uttarakhand government to suspend all helicopter services on the Char Dham Yatra route for two days.

title: Wayne Gretzky caught in backlash; Trump calls him ‚Äòa free agent‚Äô; Canadians question his loyalty
content: Wayne Gretzky, a Canadian icon, faces backlash for his association with Donald Trump, particularly after Trump's remarks about Canada. Critics question Gretzky's Canadian identity, fueled by images of him at Trump events. Despite Gretzky's attempts to remain neutral, his silence on Trump's policies and his wife's social media activity have intensified the controversy, potentially impacting his legacy in Canada.

title: IND vs ENG: Former cricketer warns Gill, says 'don't go down the wrong path'
content: Aakash Chopra cautions India against prioritising batting depth over bowling strength for the first Test against England at Headingley. He advises captain Shubman Gill to learn from past mistakes and field at least three specialist fast bowlers. Chopra suggests options like Shardul Thakur or a four-pronged pace attack alongside a specialist batter to bolster the team's composition.

title: Happy father's day: 75+ messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes
content: Father's Day, celebrated globally on the third Sunday of June, honors fathers and father figures for their guidance and love. Originating in the US in the early 20th century, Sonora Smart Dodd championed the holiday, officially recognized in 1972. Celebrations vary across cultures, emphasizing family time and appreciation.

title: Gut feeling, gridlock & a mom‚Äôs plea ‚Äì How fate stopped 7 from taking AI 171
content: Seven passengers narrowly avoided tragedy on Air India Flight 171 due to a series of unforeseen circumstances. A mother's heartfelt plea, paperwork issues, a sudden change of heart, traffic delays, and a delayed business trip all conspired to keep them off the ill-fated flight. While some were frustrated at the time, they later realized these obstacles were life-saving interventions.

title: Big win! China cos now exporting ‚ÄòMade in India‚Äô products to US
content: Driven by government encouragement and growing local production, Chinese smartphone and electronics manufacturers are now exporting from India to regions like West Asia, Africa, and the US. This marks a strategic shift as brands like Oppo and Realme report significant export earnings.

title: IPL: De Villiers opens up on Delhi Daredevils era; says 'a lot of poisonous characters ...'
content: AB de Villiers described his Delhi Daredevils stint as "bittersweet," highlighting internal chaos and "poisonous characters" despite playing alongside legends like Glenn McGrath and Daniel Vettori. De Villiers felt valued initially but was surprisingly released into the auction after a diminished role in 2010.

title: 'India's blood not meant to be shed': Shah credits PM for tough stance on terror
content: Union home minister Amit Shah credited Prime Minister Modi for a stern message to the world following Operation Sindoor, which retaliated against the Pahalgam terror attack. Speaking in Lucknow, Shah highlighted the Modi government's strong response to terrorism compared to the Congress era.

title: Rs 193cr govt land cleared in Jamnagar crackdown: Hidden dargah, spa-like bath found
content: In Jamnagar, a coordinated police and district administration operation resulted in the reclamation of 7.74 lakh sq ft of illegally occupied government land worth Rs 193 crore. Authorities discovered a hidden dargah with lavish construction, including marble flooring and a sophisticated bathing facility, raising suspicions of illegal activities.
